#Text=Ontario Votes 2007 : Interview with NDP candidate Felicite Stairs , Renfrew-Nipissing-Pembroke
#Text=Monday , September 24 , 2007
#Text=Felicite Stairs is running for the Ontario NDP in the Ontario provincial election , in the Renfrew-Nipissing-Pembroke riding .
#Text=Wikinews ' Nick Moreau interviewed her regarding her values , her experience , and her campaign .
#Text=Stay tuned for further interviews ; every candidate from every party is eligible , and will be contacted .

#Text=Expect interviews from Liberals , Progressive Conservatives , New Democratic Party members , Ontario Greens , as well as members from the Family Coalition , Freedom , Communist , Libertarian , and Confederation of Regions parties , as well as independents .
#Text=Interview
#Text=Why have you chosen to involve yourself in the political process ?
#Text=Why did you choose to run in this constituency ?

#Text=I became involved because through my work as a legal clinic lawyer , I came into contact with many people with problems either deliberately created or inadvertently worsened by bad public policy .
#Text=I chose to run here because I live here and love the strong characters and families I meet here .
#Text=What prior political experience do you have ?
#Text=What skills and insight can you bring to office , from other non-political positions you may have held ?
#Text=I ran for the first time in the 2003 provincial election and have been involved in NDP politics for about 15 years .
#Text=I have worked with and , in several cases , helped found a range of non-profit community organizations , as well as others working at the provincial and national levels .
#Text=As a lawyer and full-time volunteer I have a good sense of how to work with people , how things get done and how to make things happen .
#Text=Which of your competitors do you expect to pose the biggest challenge to your candidacy ? Why ?

#Text=John Yakabuski , as incumbent and as the capital-C conservative in a riding that is in many ways conservative-minded , has a large advantage , especially due to the loyalty his late father , the former MPP Paul Yakabuski , commanded .
#Text=What makes you the most desirable of all candidates running in the riding ?
#Text=Renfrew-Nipissing-Pembroke is economically disadvantaged .
#Text=People here need an advocate who takes up the case of ordinary people and families .
#Text=The Conservatives and Liberals are the voices of big business and the well-off .
#Text=Their policies do not represent the best interests of the kind of lower- and middle-income families who live here .
#Text=The NDP 's policies and commitments do .
#Text=What do you feel are the three most important issues to voters in your riding ?
#Text=It is hard to settle on just three , but broadly , we might say
#Text=poverty and cuts to public services
#Text=rural decline and the lack of positive response to change in the rural economy
#Text=the needs of an aging society
#Text=Are these the same top three issues that are most important to you ?
#Text=What would you do to address these issues ?
#Text=These are some of the issues on which my campaign is focusing .
#Text=The points in my campaign literature summarize our key pledges to voters :
#Text=Increasing the minimum wage to $ 10 per hour . NOW .
#Text=Fixing the Harris/McGuinty school funding formula and putting money back into our kids ' education .
#Text=Protecting our children 's health and environment with a right-to-know law , and fighting climate change
#Text=a Heath Tax Rebate for working families and shorter health care wait times
#Text=Guaranteed minimum standards of care for seniors
#Text=Removing barriers to university , college and apprenticeship training , and rolling back tuition fees , eliminating them for apprenticeship .
#Text=What should be the first order of business in the 39th Legislative Assembly ?
#Text=Increasing the minimum wage to CA$ 10 per hour would be a good and easy place to start .
#Text=Are the property taxes in your riding at a fair level for the amount of services received in the municipality ?
#Text=No.
#Text=The assessment formula brought in by the Conservatives and never fixed by the Liberals has combined with provincial downloading to place an unfair burden on local ratepayers .
#Text=How can the province lead the way in stimulating job creation ?
#Text=An NDP government would invest in green industries , from the construction of public transportation to the installation of insulation and the production of energy-saving appliances .
#Text=This could produce new jobs and place Ontario at the forefront of a worldwide movement to fight global warming .
#Text=What are your views on the mixed member proportional representation ( MMP ) referendum ?
#Text=I support it .
#Text=The current system is antiquated .
#Text=It does not fairly reflect the views of the public and frequently results in skewed electoral results .
#Text=I believe the referendum proposal is a good step toward correcting these problems .
#Text=What role , if any , does “ new media ” play in your campaign , and the campaign of your party ?
#Text=( websites , blogs , Facebook , YouTube videos , etc ) Do you view it as beneficial , or a challenge ?
#Text=We use our website and email extensively in our campaign .
#Text=They have completely changed how we run campaigns .
#Text=Because there are so few opportunities for young people in this area , many leave .
#Text=We wish we had more young people involved to further promote the use of new technologies .
#Text=Technology , however , will never replace human contact , and it should not be allowed to do so .
#Text=Of the decisions made by Ontario 's 38th Legislative Assembly , which was the most beneficial to your this electoral district ?
#Text=To the province as a whole ?
#Text=Which was least beneficial , or even harmful , to your this riding ?
#Text=To the province as a whole ?
#Text=I am glad the Liberal government stopped vilifying public servants in the way their predecessor did .
#Text=What bothers me is that , beside the famous broken promises , so much of what the Liberals did in government has perpetuated the damage and problems created by the Conservatives .
#Text=The funding formula continues to inadequately fund schools .
#Text=Public service cuts from natural resources to agriculture to court houses make life harder and harder for rural communities .
#Text=Unfair tax assessment continues .
#Text=Public housing programs and social assistance policies remain inadequate and punitive .
#Text=There is a lengthy list of problems for our rural communities created or worsened by the Conservatives and left to fester by the McGuinty Liberals .
